programme.desc: From cult heroes to anti-establishment satire, actress and filmmaker Heidi Honeycutt talks her favorite movies.

programme.desc: Masterful movie maker Mick Garris joins Trailers from Hell to talk about his favorite films.

programme.desc: Horror maestro Mick Garris looks back on iconic genre films of the 80s, 90s, and 2000s.

programme.desc: SAW director Darren Lynn Bousman introduces a gripping blend of psychological horror, supernatural chills, and classic creature features.

programme.desc: SAW director Darren Lynn Bousman talks about his favorite psychological thrillers, dark dramas, and cult musicals.

programme.title: Here Comes Frankenstein!
programme.desc: Your favorite filmmakers examine the history of the Frankenstein monster on screen!

programme.title: Jesse James Meets Frankensteins Daughter
programme.desc: The infamous outlaw Jesse James crosses paths with Dr. Frankenstein's murderous granddaughter, Maria.

programme.title: Karloff: The King of Horror
programme.desc: Boris Karloff's portrayal of monsters and villains made him the undisputed king of 20th century horror.

programme.title: Monsters & Misfits: The Legacy of Lon Chaney Jr.
programme.desc: Celebrate Lon Chaney Jr.’s big screen legacy of classic creatures and complex misfits.

programme.title: Dracula and the Hollywood Vampires
programme.desc: The legendary Count Dracula inspires a bevy of onscreen bloodsuckers!

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: In director F.W. Murnau’s unauthorized adaptation of Bram Stoker’s 1897 novel Dracula, vampire Count Orlock (Max Schreck) leaves Transylvania in search of a young woman, Ellen Hutter (Greta Schroder), while evading her husband, Thomas (Gustav von Wangenheim), and the Van Helsing-esque Professor Bulwer (Gustav Botz). A monumental achievement in German Expressionism, Nosferatu is revered as one of the most influential horror films of all time.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Beyond Dracula
programme.desc: From monster mashups and horror hijinks, Bela Lugosi was much more than cinema’s greatest vampire.

programme.title: Mummies, Werewolves, and More Monsters!
programme.desc: From the tombs of Egypt to the Paris Opera House, the monsters are on the loose!

programme.desc: Universal Horror Volume 1

programme.title: Christopher Lee: From Fangs to Frights
programme.desc: From Hammer hits to Corman classics and more, these movies made Christopher Lee a horror icon.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: Your favorite filmmakers take you inside Britain's iconic Hammer Film factory.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: Take a journey into the heart of Hammer horror with today's top filmmakers.

programme.title: Horror Express
programme.desc: Passengers aboard a Trans-Siberian Express train must fight to stay alive after a prehistoric creature escapes captivity and begins a murder spree.

programme.title: Vincent Price: Master of the Silver Scream
programme.desc: From 'Haunted Hill' to Corman classics, Vincent Price sent shivers down the spines of horror fans for decades.

programme.title: Stephen King Stories and Decoding David Lynch
programme.desc: From Carrie to Eraserhead and beyond, Stephen King and David Lynch have defined cinematic storytelling for decades.

programme.title: Joe Dante’s Noir Nightmares
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante celebrates the noir classics that explore themes of identity, paranoia, and duality.

programme.title: Terror Titans: The Films of Wes Craven and John Carpenter
programme.desc: Two masters of horror bring your nightmares to the big screen in this spine-chilling collection.

programme.title: The Best of Blaxploitation
programme.desc: From Shaft to Coffy to Truck Turner and more, celebrating the best action films of the Blaxploitation genre.

programme.title: The Black Cobra 2
programme.desc: Chicago cop Robert Malone (Fred Williamson) finds himself in The Philippines, ostensibly to learn the techniques of Interpol. Before he exits the Manila airport, his wallet is stolen by a pickpocket. Malone endures a testy relationship with his new colleague Kevin McCall while evidence surrounding the stolen wallet pulls both of them deeper and deeper into a web of intrigue.

programme.title: Rebels, Icons, and Revolution: A Journey Through Black Cinema
programme.desc: Celebrating the bold storytelling, unforgettable characters, and cultural impact of Black cinema.

programme.title: The Final Comedown
programme.desc: Billy Dee Williams stars as the leader of a group of young militants battling injustice and racism in this film also released under the title Blast!

programme.title: Cinematic Soul: Black Stories in Film
programme.desc: Your favorite filmmakers discuss the action, resilience, and cultural impact of Black cinema throughout the decades.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: ‘Shaft,” and “Foxy Brown” all rolled out to the “Car Wash” with “Sweet Sweetbacks Badasss Song” on the radio!

programme.title: Joshua
programme.desc: A former Union soldier becomes a bounty hunter and vows to track down the racist thugs that murdered his mother.
